title: [Gameplay] Pool Party Zac bugged?
body:
So after loading into a game on summoners rift with pool party Zac active I looked to see the skin is much darker than normal. The blobs from his passive however look to be the correct color.

Anyone else having this problem?

Steps to recreate:
1. Enter game with pool party zac.
2. activate passive by hitting with a skill.

replies.body:
Hiya! 

I just loaded up with him in game and I didn't see him appearing darker than normal. 

I've attached a screenshot of what I'm seeing - are you seeing something different?

Hey! I found this thread searching up my issue on google and since the author didn't respond I thought I'd show you my screen shot of the darker pool party zac. I was playing a team builder and when I loaded in I was dumbfounded at the dark color of the skin. (Unfortunately my print screen during that game ended up being a black screen, so instead I have a loaded up custom game.) Also here is an album link to a few more screen shots.  

h ttp://imgur.com/a/Nn5CS
 
(Because I can't get the hyperlink to work without making it a picture I broke the link up at the h)

BIG IMPORTANT EDIT: I just changed my settings from Very Low to the highest settings with the slider (it seems to be character model, only at very low). This fixed the skin. I can't play on those graphics though so is this intended to happen?

Hey! 

You're correct that Pool Party Zac looks light except on Very Low settings.

Zac uses spec tech, which makes him shiny, and that doesn't apply on Very Low settings (since it's a lower visual setting).

Similar things happen with Special Weapons Zac - he appears darker and less shiny on Very Low settings.

I heard a rumor that on the dark side of skin creation, in secluded alleyways of the internet, there are modders who turn off that effect on all settings to make skins for him look a specific way.

 
Just a rumor, and nothing an actual skin could have to give Zac a more... Solid feel. *Wink Wink, Nudge Nudge*
